titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elizabeth Jane Miller family papers 1977.280
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-12-11T16:21-0500

did.abstract: The collection includes one scrapbook (disbound) and two baby biography books, all of which document members of the Miller family of the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, dating from 1842 to 1965.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level by Nicholas Pavlik on June 20, 2011. Photographs and baby biography books, which had been separated from the collection prior to processing, were reintegrated into the collection by John Zarrillo in December 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Jane Miller (1871-1965) was the daughter of Dr. Francis Frost Miller and Susette Henes, and was born and raised on Highland Avenue in the Brooklyn neighborhood of East New York. In the early 1890s, she attended school in Germany. In 1894, she married Charles E. Miller at Trinity Episcopal Church in East New York.

An extensive genealogy of the family is held in the accession file for the portrait of Sophia Theresia Miller (M1974.35). Researchers interested in this file should consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Elizabeth Jane Miller family papers, 1977.280, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Portraits of Joseph Ignatz Miller (M1974.36) and Sophia Theresia Miller (M1974.35) are part of Brooklyn Historical Society's portrait collection. They were also donated by Vera Keppler in 1966.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes one scrapbook (disbound) and two baby biography books, all of which document members of the Miller family of the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, dating from 1842 to 1965.

The scrapbook was compiled by Elizabeth Jane Miller, and includes correspondence in English and German, news clippings relating to the Miller family, birth records of Elizabeth Jane Miller, invitations to the marriage of Elizabeth Jane and Charles E. Miller, calling cards, postcards and programs from Trinity Episcopal Church in East New York, and other memorabilia. It features a number of photographs in an assortment of formats, including cyanotypes, tintypes, albumen prints, cabinet cards, and color prints. The photographs depict numerous Miller family members, as well as their home. The papers include memorabilia such as a leather wallet, dried flowers and leaves, and fabric samples.

The collection also includes two baby biography books of Elizabeth's children, Vera Louise Miller and John Lester Miller. Dating from the 1890s through the 1920s, these books document the early lives of the Miller children and include an assortment of ephemera.
